intro: Primula silvia, commonly known as the Silvia primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
